oai_dc:dc.dc:title: How does preweaning vaccination impact gene expression in cattle that remain healthy or develop BRD later in life?
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: McAllister, Hudson
Capik, Sarah
Ramirez, Bradley
Harvey, Kelsey
Valeris-Chacin, Robert
Karisch, Brandi
Woolums, Amelia
Scott, Matthew
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Bovine respiratory disease (BRD) remains a priority topic withÂ­in livestock research. A leading topic of BRD-related research is vaccination of pre-weaned calves to mitigate the effects of BRD post-weaning. Comparison of gene expression pathways in vaccinated and unvaccinated calves that develop or resist BRD would help clarify factors that may result in benefits following vaccination.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; Vol. 58 No. 58 (2024): 2024 AABP Annual Conference Proceedings; 214
